topic.title: Device Power Sequence Device Bays tabs
topic.keywords: device bays power sequence power sequence device bays

p.b: Device Bays Standard tab and Double Dense tabs

content.p: If all interconnect modules are powered off, the power delay feature is enabled during the Onboard Administrator boot process. When the Onboard Administrator determines that power delay sequencing is enabled, a timer starts, and then each device powers on after the specified delay time. If all interconnect modules are not powered off, the devices power on normally without any power delay sequencing.
If a delay time of zero is set for a device, then power delay sequencing has no effect on any power requests for that device.

If No Poweron is selected for a device, the device cannot power on, even by manually pushing the power button. After all devices have completed the delays, the No Poweron status clears, and the devices are powered on normally.

td.p: The type of device in the bay or Absent if no device is installed in the bay
Enables power sequencing, disables power sequencing, or does not allow powering on of the device if No Poweron is selected.
The amount of delay, in seconds, before the device powers on. Possible delay values are 1 to 3600.
